Introduction.content:
Crispy, golden potato samosas – the ultimate vegetarian street-food king!

From the beaches of Zanzibar to India, Pakistan, Kenya, UK halal shops, and American food trucks, everyone goes crazy for a hot potato samosa.

This ebook gives you the **exact restaurant and street-vendor recipe** – super spicy, flavour-packed filling with a shell that stays crunchy for hours. Perfect for home, parties, Ramadan/Iftar, or starting a small samosa business anywhere in the world.

Chapter 1: Ingredients (Makes 30–35 medi.content:
### For the Potato Filling
- 1 kg (2.2 lb) potatoes – boiled, peeled & roughly mashed
- 3 tbsp cooking oil
- 1 tsp cumin seeds
- 2 large onions – very finely chopped
- 4–5 green chilies – finely chopped
- 1-inch ginger – grated
- 4 cloves garlic – minced
- 1 cup green peas (frozen or fresh)
- 2 tsp salt (or to taste)
- 1 tsp turmeric powder
- 2 tsp ground coriander
- 2 tsp ground cumin
- 1–2 tsp red chili powder (or chili flakes)
- 1 tsp garam masala
- 1 tsp amchur (dry mango powder) OR juice of 1 lemon
- ½ tsp black pepper
- Big handful fresh coriander – chopped
- Optional: 1 tsp fennel seeds, ½ tsp asafoetida (hing)

### For the Pastry (same as beef samosa)
- 500g (4 cups) all-purpose flour
- 1 tsp salt
- 4 tbsp oil or ghee
- 180–200 ml water
- Extra flour for rolling

### For Sealing & Frying
- Paste: 2 tbsp flour + 4 tbsp water
- Oil for deep frying

Chapter 2: Step 1 – Make the Dough (Same.content:
1. Mix flour + salt
2. Rub in oil/ghee until crumbly
3. Add water gradually → knead 8–10 minutes until smooth
4. Cover with damp cloth → rest 30–45 minutes

Pro tip: Good dough = crispy samosa. Don’t skip the resting time!

https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1599921841143-819065a16493?ixlib=rb-4.0.3&auto=format&fit=crop&w=800&q=80
*Smooth, rested samosa pastry dough*

Chapter 3: Step 2 – Cook the Famous Spic.content:
1. Heat oil → add cumin seeds (let them crackle)
2. Add onions → fry golden brown (8–10 mins)
3. Add ginger + garlic + green chili → fry 1 minute
4. Add turmeric, coriander, cumin, chili powder → stir 30 seconds
5. Add green peas → cook 2 minutes
6. Add mashed potatoes + salt → mix very well
7. Cook on medium heat 5–7 minutes, keep mashing and mixing
8. Add garam masala + amchur/lemon juice + fresh coriander
9. Taste & adjust spice → filling should be bold and tangy!
10. Cool completely (very important)

Secret: The filling must be completely dry and cool – zero moisture = zero bursting.

https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1625944233744-2a44a0058d0b?ixlib=rb-4.0.3&auto=format&fit=crop&w=800&q=80
*Bright yellow spicy potato filling with peas*

Chapter 4: Step 3 – Fold the Perfect Tri.content:
1. Divide rested dough into 15–17 balls
2. Roll one ball into 15 cm (6 inch) oval
3. Cut in half → you get two semi-circles
4. Make cone, seal edge with flour paste
5. Fill with 1½–2 tbsp cold potato filling
6. Seal the top tightly → perfect triangle
7. Keep covered with damp cloth while you finish the rest

https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1660837187098-2c9813ed2ea6?ixlib=rb-4.0.3&auto=format&fit=crop&w=800&q=80
*Step-by-step potato samosa folding*

Chapter 5: Step 4 – Fry to Golden Crispy.content:
### The Double-Fry Method (Street-Vendor Secret)
1. First fry → medium-low oil (160–170°C) for 8–10 minutes until pale golden
2. Remove & cool 10–15 minutes
3. Second fry → medium-high oil (180–190°C) for 3–5 minutes until deep golden and super crispy

Result: Crunch that lasts 8+ hours – exactly like the pros!

Single fry (home version): Fry on medium heat 12–15 minutes, turning often.

https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1596797038530-2f3729b3c0bf?ixlib=rb-4.0.3&auto=format&fit=crop&w=800&q=80
*Stack of perfect golden potato samosas*

Chapter 6: Freezing & Make-Ahead.content:
- Freeze uncooked samosas on a tray → then bag them (lasts 3–4 months)
- Fry straight from frozen (add 4–5 extra minutes)
- Cooked samosas → reheat in oven/air-fryer at 180°C for 8–10 mins (crispy again)
- Never microwave – they go soft!

Chapter 7: Serving & Best Chutneys.content:
### Classic Pairings
- Tamarind chutney (imli)
- Mint-coriander green chutney
- Red garlic chutney
- Hot masala chai

Perfect for iftar, veg parties, school snacks, or selling at markets worldwide!

https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1625944233744-2a44a0058d0b?ixlib=rb-4.0.3&auto=format&fit=crop&w=800&q=80
*Potato samosas served with mint chutney*

Chapter 8: Troubleshooting.content:
- Bursting open → filling too wet or overfilled
- Soft samosas → oil too hot on first fry or no double fry
- Bland taste → didn’t add enough salt/chili/amchur in filling
- Dough cracking → didn’t rest long enough or too little oil in dough
- Oily samosas → oil temperature too low
